importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was updated on this date, indicating the announcement of the new Netflix series, which marks a significant cultural and media development involving a prominent American political family.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, beginning with Joe and Rose Kennedy’s early lives and covering key formative years of the Kennedy family, setting the stage for the rise of John F. Kennedy in American politics.

keyTakeAways: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917-1956,' focusing on the Kennedy family’s rise and struggles.
Michael Fassbender will star as Joe Kennedy, Sr., portraying the patriarch of the family, and the series will explore both triumphs and tragedies in the Kennedy dynasty.
The series begins in the 1930s and follows the lives of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, with special attention to Jack Kennedy’s struggle to escape his brother's shadow.

The show is described as a blend of American mythology and human drama, offering insight into the personal struggles behind the Kennedy legend, with relevance to modern American identity and political culture.
The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy's upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr., and will consist of eight episodes without a confirmed release date.
The narrative draws from a nuanced historical biography, aiming to illuminate how the Kennedys reflect broader American societal values and challenges.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform that has announced a new original drama series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is the producer and distributor of the new Kennedy series, making it central to the announcement and global accessibility of the show.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A British actor known for his roles in films such as 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo' and 'Star Wars: The Last Jedi'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fassbender is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., a pivotal figure in the Kennedy family, adding significant star power and credibility to the series.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An American political dynasty that includes presidents, senators, and other public figures.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is central to the narrative, representing a symbol of American political power and mythos, with a history of both success and tragedy.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The 35th U.S. president, son of Joe Kennedy, Sr., and a central figure in American political history.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: John F. Kennedy is a key figure in the family’s legacy, and the series traces his rise from childhood to his presidency, highlighting the family’s political influence.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The patriarch of the Kennedy family, father of John F. Kennedy and other prominent family members.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is portrayed by Michael Fassbender and is central to the narrative, representing the foundation of the Kennedy family’s political ascent.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A historian and author of the biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917-1956'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His book serves as the source material for the series, lending historical depth and authenticity to the portrayal of the Kennedy family.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Showrunner of the series, responsible for overall creative direction and narrative structure.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Shaw provides the narrative vision of the series, emphasizing the human complexity behind the Kennedy mythos.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a 1999 plane crash with his wife and sister-in-law.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His tragic death is cited as part of the Kennedy family’s legacy of tragedy, reinforcing the narrative of a 'curse' and personal suffering within the family.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A television producer known for 'American Horror Story' and other dramas.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Murphy is mentioned as the creator of a separate upcoming series about JFK Jr., distinguishing the new Netflix series from that project.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography, which explores the rise and tragedies of the Kennedy family from the 1930s to 1956. The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and follows the family’s journey through political ambition, personal conflict, and loss. The narrative emphasizes the human side of a political dynasty, drawing parallels between the Kennedys and broader American values and struggles. The show is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming series on JFK Jr. and will consist of eight episodes, though a release date has not yet been announced.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
